attention2.ptxt: Performing this prohibited service will affect its original performance.

s1.ptxt: Give match marks (1) on flange yoke and shaft as shown in the figure.
Using snap ring plier (1), remove 2 circlips.
Using special tool, push spider bearing race out 3 – 4 mm (0.12 – 0.16 in.) from shaft yoke race.

attention3.ptxt: Before pushing it out, apply penetrate lubricant between bearing race (1) and yoke race (2).

s1.ptxt: Tapping yoke with a hammer, completely remove bearing race.
Take out bearing race on the other side in the same way as in Step 3) and 4).
Push out bearing race on flange yoke side as described in Step 2) and 3), and then, holding bearing race in a vise (1), tap flange yoke and take out race. (Refer to the figure.)
Remove bearing race on the opposite side in the same way.

item.ptxt: Take care not to lose rollers in spider bearing race when removing it.
Fit removed bearings temporarily in spider so that they can be reinstalled in their original positions.

attention3.ptxt: Make sure that rollers inside spider bearing race are all in place.

attention2.ptxt: In assembly, be sure to use new circlips, spider (1) and bearings (2). Reuse of circlips, spider (1) and bearings (2) once assembled is prohibited.

s1.ptxt: Make sure to apply grease to spider bearing race.
Insert bearing race into yoke, using press, until it is flush with yoke face. When doing this, insert spider into bearing race to prevent rollers in bearing race from coming out.
Aligning match marks (1) and insert the other bearing race on the opposite side into yoke, using press until it is flush with yoke face.
Insert bearing races on the flange yoke side in the same way as described in Step 1) and 2).
Securely fit 4 circlips to shaft and flange yoke.

item.ptxt: Make sure that each circlip is fitted in groove securely.

s1.ptxt: After assembly, check to ensure that both shaft yoke and flange yoke move smoothly.
